settings.text_content: First There Was Fire. Then, The Kasai..
settings.description: Kasai Konro charcoal grills are inspired by world famous Japanese design. They’re a traditional heat source used to make delicious meats, fish, and vegetables.

settings.title: Going Back To Basics
settings.description: Kasai Konro charcoal grills are inspired by world famous Japanese design. They’re a traditional heat source used to make delicious meats, fish, and vegetables. Enjoyed by the best restaurant chefs and home users, Kasai is more than a charcoal grill. It’s a versatile bit of kit that can hold anything from kebabs, to yakitori skewers, and even hold your pans for you with interchangeable racks.

settings.heading: Key Features
settings.description: The tiles for our Kasai Grills are made from vermiculite, which goes through an exfoliation process to become our Kasai Tile. We offer replacement tiles to restaurants and home users once the tiles reach end of life. The old tiles are then ground and given to gardeners to use as an effective soil conditioner.

settings.heading: Our ambassador
settings.description:
Banks was born and raised in the small North Yorkshire village of Oldstead. He grew up there with his older brother, James, and parents, Tom and Anne Banks.

Banks comes from a farming background, with the Banks family farming in and around Oldstead for five generations. The Banks family also ran a B&B from their family home before buying their local pub, The Black Swan, in 2006.

settings.heading: Japanese Inspired. Truly British
settings.description: Kasai Konro charcoal grills are inspired by world famous Japanese design. They're a traditional heat source used to make delicious meats, fish, and vegetables. Enjoyed by the best restaurant chefs and home users, Kasai is more than a charcoal grill.

settings.heading: Loved by the Starts
settings.description: Michlein star Head Chef, Tommy Banks Uses Our kasai while cooking  at home , and in both of his Michlein star restaurants; The black swan at  Oldstaed, and roots in york.
